abstract.text: Display nested views using a configurable and highly customizable layout.

inlineContent.text: A collection view manages an ordered set of content, such as the grid of photos in the Photos app, and presents it visually.
Collection views are a collaboration between many different objects, including:
Cells. A cell provides the visual representation for each piece of your content.
Layouts. A layout defines the visual arrangement of the content in the collection view.
Your data source object. This object adopts the
protocol and provides the data for the collection view.
Your delegate object. This object adopts the
protocol and manages user interactions with the collection view’s contents, like selection and highlighting.
Collection view controller. You typically use a
object to manage a collection view. You can use other view controllers too, but a collection view controller is required for some collection-related features to work.

abstract.text: Add auto layout constraints to your app to achieve localizable views.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Autosizing Views for Localization in iOS

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A representation of the state of the data in a layout section at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a layout section at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a view at a specific point in time.
A representation of the state of the data in a view at a specific point in time.
A view that defines the behavior for all cells and supplementary views presented by a collection view.
An object that manages an ordered collection of data items and presents them using customizable layouts.
A single data item when that item is within the collection view’s visible bounds.
A view controller that specializes in managing a collection view.
The methods adopted by the object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
A protocol that provides advance warning of the data requirements for a collection view, allowing the triggering of asynchronous data load operations.
The methods adopted by the object you use to manage user interactions with items in a collection view.
The object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
The object you use to manage data and provide cells for a collection view.
The interface for initiating drags from a collection view.
An interface for coordinating your custom drop-related actions with the collection view.
The interface for handling drops in a collection view.
The data associated with an item being dropped into the collection view.
A placeholder for an item dropped on a collection view.
An object that contains information about a placeholder in the collection view.
Your proposed solution for handling a drop in a collection view.
A collection view cell that provides list features and default styling.
A placeholder for an item dragged or dropped on a collection view.
An advanced interface for managing a data source object.
A standard control that can initiate the refreshing of a scroll view’s contents.
A view that allows the scrolling and zooming of its contained views.
A streamlined interface for laying out a collection of views in either a column or a row.
Improve the performance of lists and collections in your app with prefetching and image preparation.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Building high-performance lists and collection views

abstract.text: Provide visual feedback to the user about the state of a cell and the transition between states.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Changing the appearance of selected and highlighted cells

abstract.text: Bring compositional layouts to your app and simplify updating your user interface with diffable data sources.
Arrange your collection view content in a highly configurable layout.
Accelerate user selection of multiple items using the multiselect gesture on table and collection views.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Selecting multiple items with a two-finger pan gesture

abstract.text: Initiate drags and handle drops from a collection view.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Supporting Drag and Drop in Collection Views

abstract.text: Display data in a single column of customizable rows.
Streamline the display and update of data in a collection view using a diffable data source that contains identifiers.

doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKi.title: Updating collection views using diffable data sources

abstract.text: Present your content onscreen and define the interactions allowed with that content.
